channel.title: April Dammann – Los Angeles Visionaries Association

item.title: LAVA Visionary author April Dammann signs books at West Hollywood Book Fair
item.dc:creator: April Dammann
item.description: LAVA Visionary author April Dammann signs copies of her art history/biography, Exhibitionist: Earl Stendahl, Art Dealer as Impresario  on Sunday, September 30, 10 – noon at the West Hollywood Book Fair in the Angel City Press booth. The fair surrounds the West Hollywood Library on San Vicente Boulevard. Please come. It’s April’s birthday that day. […]
item.content:encoded: LAVA Visionary author April Dammann signs copies of her art history/biography, Exhibitionist: Earl Stendahl, Art Dealer as Impresario  on Sunday, September 30, 10 – noon at the West Hollywood Book Fair in the Angel City Press booth. The fair surrounds the West Hollywood Library on San Vicente Boulevard. Please come. It’s April’s birthday that day. No gifts, please, but consider buying a book!

item.title: “LOOKING BOXES” Playful Ways of Seeing the World
item.dc:creator: April Dammann
item.description: The Stendahl Galleries of Hollywood presents the opening reception for â€œLOOKING BOXESâ€ Playful Ways of Seeing the World by artist and industrial designer Maynard Hale Lyndon. Boxes and accompanying books for sale. Maynard Hale Lyndonâ€™s design legacy took root in Boston with Design Research, the store that brought modern living to American homes. On the […]
item.content:encoded:
The Stendahl Galleries of Hollywood presents the opening reception for â€œLOOKING BOXESâ€ Playful Ways of Seeing the World by artist and industrial designer Maynard Hale Lyndon.

Boxes and accompanying books for sale.

Maynard Hale Lyndonâ€s design legacy took root in Boston with Design Research, the store that brought modern living to American homes. On the West Coast, he founded an award-winning toy store (Santa Monica, 1967) and directed product development at Forms&Surfaces (Santa Barbara).

On view: a choreography of memory and impression: â€œLooking Boxes are my layered constructions, wherein I juxtapose images from the thousands of photographs I have taken, (many in Los Angeles) stretching back to 1962. The boxes combine details of places in surprising and serendipitous scenes. Each is one-of-a-kind. There are no duplicates.â€ Custom boxes on special order, with the collectorâ€s own photographs.

The Stendahl Galleries celebrates one hundred years of continuous operation and is a proud participant in Pacific Standard Time.

PARKING: Street parking (read the signs) and up driveway at the home/gallery

item.title: Open House at the historic Stendahl Galleries
item.dc:creator: April Dammann
item.description: To sign up for this free event: First register as a user on this site, and then return to this page. Refresh the page and the signup tab will appear just to the left, above this paragraph. Click “signup” and reserve your spot. No plus-ones; each guest must register individually. You are cordially invited to […]
item.content:encoded:
To sign up for this free event: First register as a user on this site, and then return to this page. Refresh the page and the signup tab will appear just to the left, above this paragraph. Click “signup” and reserve your spot. No plus-ones; each guest must register individually.

You are cordially invited to an Open House at the historic home/gallery of LAVA Visionary April Dammann and her husband Ron Dammann, president of Stendahl Galleries, a participating gallery in Pacific Standard Time.

April will lead informal gallery tours and speak about her new book, Exhibitionist: Earl Stendahl, Art Dealer as Impresario, which chronicles the life and times of her husbandâ€s grandfather, a pioneering art dealer in Los Angeles. Exhibitionist made book critic David Kipenâ€s top ten list of â€œBest Booksâ€ published in California in 2011.

PARKING: There is limited street parking, so carpooling is recommended. Read the signs to ensure you are parking legally.

item.content:encoded:
The Stendahl Galleries of Hollywood presents the opening reception for â€œLOOKING BOXESâ€ Playful Ways of Seeing the World by artist and industrial designer Maynard Hale Lyndon.

Boxes and accompanying books for sale.

Maynard Hale Lyndonâ€s design legacy took root in Boston with Design Research, the store that brought modern living to American homes. On the West Coast, he founded an award-winning toy store (Santa Monica, 1967) and directed product development at Forms&Surfaces (Santa Barbara).

On view: a choreography of memory and impression: â€œLooking Boxes are my layered constructions, wherein I juxtapose images from the thousands of photographs I have taken, (many in Los Angeles) stretching back to 1962. The boxes combine details of places in surprising and serendipitous scenes. Each is one-of-a-kind. There are no duplicates.â€ Custom boxes on special order, with the collectorâ€s own photographs.

The Stendahl Galleries celebrates one hundred years of continuous operation and is a proud participant in Pacific Standard Time.

PARKING: Street parking (read the signs) and up driveway at the home/gallery

RSVP to Stendahl Galleries by email

Note: This is the announcement for the Friday night opening on April 27th. The show will run through Sunday, April 29. Weekend hours: 10am â€“ 5 pm. No RSVP required for Saturday or Sunday visits.

item.title: Bio
item.dc:creator: April Dammann
item.description: I am a local theatrical producer and author of a recently published book: Exhibitionist: Earl Stendahl, Art Dealer as Impresario. Earl Stendahl (1888-1966) who was my husbandâ€™s grandfather, was a true visionary. He championed the unknown California Impressionist painters of the 1910s-1930s and almost single-handedly introduced Modern and Pre-Columbian art to the West Coast. My […]
item.content:encoded:
I am a local theatrical producer and author of a recently published book: Exhibitionist: Earl Stendahl, Art Dealer as Impresario. Earl Stendahl (1888-1966) who was my husbandâ€s grandfather, was a true visionary. He championed the unknown California Impressionist painters of the 1910s-1930s and almost single-handedly introduced Modern and Pre-Columbian art to the West Coast. My husband is the President of Stendahl Galleries in Los Angeles, which is one hundred years old this year.

I am an organizer for a fundraising/friend-raising event to benefit Hedgebrook â€“ the writers colony for women writers located on Whidbey Island, Puget Sound, Washington. I have been a writing resident at Hedgebrook three times; these quiet, inspiring stays transformed my writing life, and the Southern California Leadership Council hopes to bring money and new support to the organization.

Stendahl Galleries of Art is one of the participating cultural institutions in The Getty Research Instituteâ€s Pacific Standard Time collaboration, now unfolding throughout Southern California.

item.title: Hedgebrook for Women Writers benefit: Garden Party and Silent Auction
item.dc:creator: April Dammann
item.description: A Garden Party and Silent Auction to benefit Hedgebrook Saturday, October 29th 2 to 5 pm (14:00 – 17:00) Stendahl Galleries 7065 Hillside Avenue Hollywood, CA 90068 (323) 876-7740 Please join us for an afternoon of food, drink, art, film and literature to benefit Hedgebrook, the countryâ€™s foremost writerâ€™s colony for women writers. Featured readers […]
item.content:encoded:
A Garden Party and Silent Auction to benefit Hedgebrook

Saturday, October 29th
2 to 5 pm (14:00 – 17:00)

Stendahl Galleries
7065 Hillside Avenue
Hollywood, CA 90068
(323) 876-7740
Please join us for an afternoon of food, drink, art, film and literature to benefit Hedgebrook, the countryâ€s foremost writerâ€s colony for women writers.
Featured readers will include award-winning novelists, Janet Fitch (White Oleander and Paint it Black), Leslie Schwartz and playwright and screenwriter, Julia Cho.
This is a rare opportunity to view new LAVA member April Dammannâ€s beautiful historic home and art gallery, Stendahl Galleries, while enjoying wonderful drinks and food catered by cookbook author Cecilia Hae-Jin Lee.
Come bid on our fabulous silent auction items which include a wonderful selection of books, artworks, restaurant gift certificates, hair cuts, yoga sessions, dance lessons, and support a great cause!
Detailed information is available at:
https://www.hedgebrook.org/eventdetails.php?id=39

 
Tickets are $25
available at the door or in advance at
https://www.hedgebrook.org/eventdetails.php?id=39
An event has been created on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=207367602664285
